body_html:
I ended up getting this error:

RuntimeError: No CUDA implementation of 'gesvd'. Install MAGMA and rebuild cutorch (http://icl.cs.utk.edu/magma/) at at c:\anaconda2\conda-bld\pytorch_1519501749874\work\torch\lib\thc\generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu:661

I'm not quite sure why it's referencing my Anaconda2 installation when I'm under the impression that I'm running the code from my C:\Anaconda3 distribution of anaconda, unless I'm mistaken. (I'm using the environment that is only in my Anaconda3 installation, and when I run python at the system console in my activated conda environment, it brings up my python 3 interactive prompt. I'm also using the console specifically from my Anaconda3 installation.)

I think the underlying issue may be the same issue that is referenced here: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3543

It occurs when I attempt to run the code from this project: https://github.com/taoxugit/AttnGAN
after I ran 2to3 to convert from Python 2 to Python 3 on the project code files and then setup the dependencies required to get the code to run the validation operation.

If anyone wants more explicit instructions to recreate the problem, I will gladly provide them.

How should we deal with issues where MAGMA is required during compilation?

RuntimeError: No CUDA implementation of 'gesvd'. Install MAGMA and rebuild cutorch (http://icl.cs.utk.edu/magma/) at  at c:\anaconda2\conda-bld\pytorch_1519501749874\work\torch\lib\thc\generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu:661

I'm not quite sure why it's referencing my Anaconda2 installation when I'm under the impression that I'm running the code from my C:\Anaconda3 distribution of anaconda, unless I'm mistaken. (I'm using the environment that is only in my Anaconda3 installation, and when I run python at the system console in my activated conda environment, it brings up my python 3 interactive prompt. I'm also using the console specifically from my Anaconda3 installation.)
I think the underlying issue may be the same issue that is referenced here: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3543
It occurs when I attempt to run the code from this project: https://github.com/taoxugit/AttnGAN
after I ran 2to3 to convert from Python 2 to Python 3 on the project code files and then setup the dependencies required to get the code to run the validation operation.
If anyone wants more explicit instructions to recreate the problem, I will gladly provide them.
How should we deal with issues where MAGMA is required during compilation?
body:
I ended up getting this error:

> RuntimeError: No CUDA implementation of 'gesvd'. Install MAGMA and rebuild cutorch (http://icl.cs.utk.edu/magma/) at  at c:\anaconda2\conda-bld\pytorch_1519501749874\work\torch\lib\thc\generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu:661

I'm not quite sure why it's referencing my Anaconda2 installation when I'm under the impression that I'm running the code from my C:\Anaconda3 distribution of anaconda, unless I'm mistaken. (I'm using the environment that is only in my Anaconda3 installation, and when I run `python` at the system console in my activated conda environment, it brings up my python 3 interactive prompt. I'm also using the console specifically from my Anaconda3 installation.)

I think the underlying issue may be the same issue that is referenced here: [https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3543](url) 

It occurs when I attempt to run the code from this project: [https://github.com/taoxugit/AttnGAN](url)
after I ran `2to3` to convert from Python 2 to Python 3 on the project code files and then setup the dependencies required to get the code to run the _validation_ operation.

If anyone wants more explicit instructions to recreate the problem, I will gladly provide them.

How should we deal with issues where MAGMA is required during compilation?
